attributes.action: Introduce LGBT relationship education, similar to heterosexual relationships.
attributes.background: If we introduce LGBT education from a young age, we are more likely to rid the country of the stigma that still affects young people, and causes bullying and harm throughout our society. Educating people will almost definitely reduce the ignorance that causes homophobia.

attributes.action: A database for compulsive gamblers to register to, banning further gambling
attributes.background: Gambling addictions are often underestimated in their control over individuals and the devastating impacts on the victim, family and friends. Effects of gambling unfortunately can include lost life savings, pensions, subsequent divorces and homelessness among many others.
attributes.additional_details: Gambling sites, advertisements, constant emails and the availability of gambling make it increasingly difficult for a compulsive gambler to resist the compulsion to gamble. Many people want to give up, the problem is the temptation, current protection offered by sites is not good enough. I propose a national data base where addicts can register to say they wish to be banned from all sites and casinos, it is then the responsibility of the sites or casinos to check this database to protect users

attributes.action: Build HS2 up to an expanded Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA)
attributes.background: DSA is soon to be linked to the M18 a new dual carriageway, the A1 being one junction along the M18 and the M1 only three junctions away.  There is a "lot" of room available for an extra runway, new train station/terminal/parking. DSA has one of the longest runways in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently a train journey from London Kings Cross to London Heathrow takes 51 mins. The fastest train from Kings Cross to Doncaster is 95 mins using existing lines and railway stock, this could be vastly reduced if HS2 were to be built in this direction noting that DSA is also 6 miles South of Doncaster station, giving an extra reduction in transfer time.

Expansion can then be progressed in the North via HS3 and the proposed road route across the Pennines to Manchester.

attributes.action: Personally apologise to HM Forces personnel dismissed due to their sexuality.
attributes.background:
Thousands of serving gay military personnel suffered intrusive investigations into their sexuality, losing homes, careers and friends. Many faced homelessness, rejection and no suitable alternative career. Many experience unemployment and poor mental health, even now.
We demand a personal apology.
attributes.additional_details:
Not one individual subjected to investigation and dismissal from HM Forces, has ever received an apology. 
In 2007, the MOD provided a watery statement of recognition, but  many didn't know about it and it certainly wasn't personal. 
There is a moral obligation to apologise for this treatment. The effects of these investigations are still very real for these people.
Given the law in this area was only repealed in the 2016 revision of the Armed Forces Bill, the time is right to apologise.

attributes.action: Allow 16/17 year olds to vote.
attributes.background: In Year 9 in secondary school we are made to choose our GCSE subjects, at 16 we can smoke, win the lottery have sex, get a job. At 17 you can drive and you start choosing your University/life root and yet we cannot vote until we're 18. WE as a generation are one of the most educated ever. FIX IT.

attributes.action: Inculde more safety elements in the driving test towards motorcycle awareness
attributes.background: too often cars drift around their lanes freely instead of staying straight, especially when moving slowly, this makes filtering through traffic Dangerous! Car drivers pay very little attention to motorcyclist. While I was learning to drive a car, not one thing was ever mentioned about a motorbike!
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hit by 2 cars within 2 years and neither of them were my fault, this could be easily avoided if people where taught about motorcyclists while learning to drive! I have witnessed more times than I care to count, cars use their full acceleration in traffic to move from a slow moving lane to a faster moving lane without thought of a motorcycle. They do this as they are not taught about about motorcyclist! This WILL save lives.

Thanks you for reading and please sign & share

attributes.action: Back into society and work schemes for survivors of sexual and domestic abuse
attributes.background: lots of centres do not receive enough funding for survivors of sexual/domestic abuse, leaving the victim vulnerable and alone. Often secluded and struggling to live. There are schemes in place to help offenders of such crimes to get back into society and working but no such scheme for victims.
attributes.additional_details: In the last few years the U.K has seen massive cuts to helplines and therapy centres that provide great help to victims of abuse. A scheme was introduced that helps offenders of such abuse get back into society and start working again after their sentence or provides skills and training in prisons. Unfortunately no such scheme is in place to help victims get back into socialising, learning new skills, being able to work and sometimes even keep their homes. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Clearly define to Donald Trump what behaviour would end our special relationship
attributes.background: We the undersigned demand a debate in parliament to clearly define, both to the UK and US governments, what behaviour by the new US President-elect in office would result in the British people demanding the end of the UK-US special relationship.
attributes.additional_details: The UK-US special relationship has been built on shared values, objectives & defence over many years. We the undersigned want the special relationship to continue but it can only be special if those values, objectives & defence are still shared. Donald Trump has been democratically elected president of the US, having made remarks during his campaign that many in the UK do not agree with. It is not our place to interfere with who is US president, but we can decide how we respond to the choice.

attributes.action: Remove Prescription Charges for Long-Term Physical/Mental Health Conditions
attributes.background:
In England you pay for prescriptions, unless you have an illness from a special list, or meet other criteria (eg age or max income/assets). This list was set in the 60s; cancer is the only new addition.

We call for those with illnesses lasting 6+ months to get free prescriptions for that illness.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800,000 people skimp on medication for cost reasons (IPSOS MORI). This raises overall NHS costs. E.g. the cost of an A&E visit for worse asthma exceeds the cost of the drugs. The regime is unfair & out of date, leaving many risking their health.

Further reading: 	
- Gilmore Report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prescription-charges-review-the-gilmore-report
- https://www.asthma.org.uk/get-involved/campaigns/our-policy-work/prescription-charges
- http://bit.ly/prescharges

attributes.action: Make the sale of non-approved spring traps illegal.
attributes.background:
At present it is only illegal to USE non-approved traps. 
The law should be extended to ban the SALE of any trap not approved under the Spring Traps Approval Order 2012.
attributes.additional_details:
The present loop-hole allows sellers to sell inferior imported traps that have not been type-approved by DEFRA. This causes unnecessary suffering as these inferior traps often maim rather than give an instant kill. 

These imports are undemining the businesses in the UK that manufacture the genuine approved products.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum term limit for the role of UK Prime Minister
attributes.background: Many countries limit the time that one individual can hold the highest political office. This prevents one individual from dominating the political agenda for too long and amassing too much power. Thus it helps to guard against authoritarianism and the domination of particular interest groups.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of countries in the world have term limits for their Heads of State. This is a widely accepted international norm.

Often these limits apply to presidents rather than prime ministers. However, since the UK is a monarchy, and the Prime Minister is more powerful than the monarch in policy making, it is appropriate to impose such a limit on UK prime ministers.

At a time when the personal power of political leaders is so important, this law is critical to preserving political freedoms.

attributes.action: Call on the government to encourage Concorde to return to the skies.
attributes.background: Concorde was an amazing supersonic passenger aircraft which was in service between London, Paris, New York and Washington DC. Unfortunately it stopped its services in 2003, making an end to supersonic travel. It's ridiculous that today it takes 8 hours to go to New York when before it was only 3.

attributes.action: Abolish road tax increase until road conditions are improved
attributes.background: Action should be taken as we are currently paying road tax, which is set to increase in the near future, when the condition of roads is appalling. So why increase it? What do we currently pay road tax for and where is our money going?

attributes.action: Payments to carers should be increased significantly.
attributes.background: Carers should be paid a decent living wage and not the pittance of £62.50 per week. Carers save the Government, billions of pounds a year. If all carers just gave up then there would not just be a crisis but total meltdown of social care. Carers should be cared for by the Government.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to have carbohydrate content lists
attributes.background:
Diabetic children all over the Uk miss hot school meals as there's no legal requirement for school to have carb  contents for their meals. 
As a diabetic child, Riley (7) has to injection insulin every time he eats, the amount depends on the carbs he is about to eat. Without this info he cannot eat
attributes.additional_details:
As a type1 diabetic you must inject inject insulin with all food and drink for life, there is no cure, there is also no cause so it's unpreventable!
The amount you inject depends on the amount of carbohydrate you are about to eat.
At the minute there is no legal requirement for schools to have this information meaning children are missing out on a hot school meal.
I believe all schools in the uk should have a list of carbohydrate contents for each meal so our children can eat a healthy hot meal

attributes.action: Urinary Tract Infections tested for and prescribed for by a pharmacist not a GP.
attributes.background: A UTI can be debilitating, testing and treatment at a pharmacy saves women the hassle of waiting for an appointment or call back from the GP for a prescription of antibiotics. It would save the NHS the cost and time of a GP testing and prescribing for a UTI.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with a UTI during NHS out of hours and had to travel (in pain) many miles for treatment. It can take 24 hours or more to receive treatment, much of which wastes NHS time and has caused myself and other women a great deal of distress. If I could be tested and treated solely at a pharmacy it would save many women time and pain and would save wasting GP time.

attributes.action: Change divorce law! Make "no fault" divorce possible.
attributes.background: No one wants to encourage a break up. But if couples talk the D-word, it is because the marriage is over. We need a simpler, administrative process that keeps kids safe and won't break the bank. It needs to help people, so they can put their kids first!
attributes.additional_details:
The law says you have to either divorce by waiting 2 years or 5 years OR you have to choose a reason like "adultery" or "unreasonable behaviour" or "desertion". 
"Why should it be easy? Kids need their parents to stay together" I hear you say...The trouble is, lawyers get round the divorce law very easily, but at great expense to their clients. Letters about petitions back and forth, outrage at the particulars, common sense out the window. ££££ for lawyers. Madness! Sign the petition to help.

attributes.action: Make the BBC a subscription-only channel and abolish the TV licence.
attributes.background: In 2016, people should not be forced to have a TV licence when they may not watch BBC programming. BBC could become a subscription-only channel akin to HBO (US) or a streaming service like Netflix.

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.

attributes.action: Provide all schools with a cardiac defibrillator machine & staff training
attributes.background: Our local junior school is fundraising £1200 to pay for a cardiac defibrillator machine and staff training as the government doesn't offer funding to schools. In the event of sudden cardiac arrest calling 999 and the use of a defibrillator machine can increase chance of survival from 6-74% !
attributes.additional_details: An excellent cardiac trained nurse has started a fundraising page at our school but what about every school/college and university that doesn't already have one it should be law.

attributes.action: Prevent a second referendum on Leaving the EU, as the majority voted leave.
attributes.background: The majority voted to leave the EU, we ask that this democratic vote be upheld & respected. We furthermore request we leave the EU single market, so we may embrace the rest of the world as a Global Britain. With opportunity to create trade deals with the rest of the world we will grow as a nation.
attributes.additional_details: Many are trying to prevent the formal leave of the U.K. From the EU, which is a direct attack on our democratic vote. Such people include Tony Blair, Richard Branson & Caroline Lucas. This was not a racist, ignorant vote to leave. It was to embrace the rest of the world, right to self rule & control of our own borders.

attributes.action: Stop funding charities that pay executives and employees  excessive wages
attributes.background:
Charities are funded & given huge sums of money from the government with out any conditions & this money is rarely used for the purpose it was intended
instead it is mostly put in the pockets of its employees in the form of extortionate wages employee wages including executives should be capped
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2550648/Fury-234-000-salary-boss-Save-Children-Charity-chiefs-huge-wages-reined-say-MPs.html

attributes.action: Create an independent ombudsman for complaints against parcel companies.
attributes.background: Users of companies such as Hermes regularly suffer lost parcels, parcels left out in the open, thrown over walls, in bins, squashed through letterboxes etc. These companies provide totally inadequate compensation, often refusing to accept responsibility, investigate or compensate.
attributes.additional_details:
Some examples of common practise by these companies:
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/2206718/hermes-delivery-driver-pictured-with-so-many-parcels-crammed-into-his-car-that-it-was-impossible-to-see-out-of-the-passenger-window/

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/weird-news/9-times-delivery-drivers-drove-customers-to-despair-a6745546.html

A litany of complaints by frustrated users with no avenue to turn to:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/490161297788303/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for rail fares to rise without inflation and improved services
attributes.background: Every year the public has to pay more to travel on a train network that is not contributing back to the paying customers who along with businesses rely on the efficient running of the railway, delays cancellations and strikes are increasing in number and action needs to be taken rapidly.

attributes.action: primary schools to teach kids private parts are private, and don't keep secrets
attributes.background: help prevent child abuse, if children no from a young age that private parts are private an don't keep secret games this can help prevent child abuse no matter how much you trust the person who looks after your child you can never totally be sure, a lot of child abuse is done by a family member.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me an sign this petition an share it, I couldn't help some one who is very close to me but this might be able to help someone else !!

attributes.action: Rethink the way dla assess babies born and affected by talipes (clubfoot)
attributes.background: My son was born in 2011 with talipes( clubfoot in 1 of his feet) it was turned inwards. From 3 days old he had a full leg cast on, every week we went a 102 mile round trip to see his consultant, At 3 months his tendon cut and then he wore ponsetti boots and bar -firstly for 23hrs a day then 12hrs.
attributes.additional_details: He couldnt kick his legs freely, he couldnt roll over in his bed to get comfortable. He was stuck on his back thumping a metal bar with his little blue boots attached. Some people get dla as the assessor see it requires 'more care' than a normal baby, but like myself we didnt.My son did require more care, and as he got older with the boots on it got harder on him and myself. Dla needs to address this and make a serious decision to if all should get it or none.They are born with this abnormality

attributes.action: more funding for paediatric cardiac teaching more complex /rare heart conditions
attributes.background: My daughter aged 6months died in hospital due to post op complications. She had ebsteins anomaly a rare heart condition.  Doctors in the UK don't know much about this condition and struggle to help fix/ and or treat accordingly.

attributes.action: Give Police a power to seize vehicles of those caught driving & using mobiles
attributes.background: Following the jailing today of Tomasz Kroker for 10 years for causing the deaths of Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith, it's time this country toughened the law on using a mobile phone behind the wheel.
attributes.additional_details: Most people don't even think about it.  They answer a call, they write or read a text whilst driving, they change music tracks like Tomasz Kroker as he drove a heavy goods vehicle.  Tracey Houghton, her two sons Josh and Ethan and her stepdaughter Aimee Goldsmith were on their way back from a holiday when they were killed instantly.  You have probably seen the moving video of their relatives describing the aftermath.  Sign this petition in their memory & for radical change.

attributes.action: Abolish the "standard living allowance" under 35!
attributes.background: I am 21 years of age. I was made homeless two weeks ago, I have done everything I possibly could while working part time to get my own place. The government will only pay for me to live in shared accommodation of £210 a month.
attributes.additional_details: I spent long enough explaining to them I am unable to live in shared accommodation due to my mental health issues. I have tried to get a one bed flat and nothing I do for universal credit is good enough. How can the government expect our future generation to live with their parents till 35 because most of us can't get help to live alone! Why are we expected to live like students? Why do they not care for people with mental or physical health disabilities? I now have two options. Live on my friends couch, or move back with my parents which I cannot do. Is this acceptable to keep our younger generation in such horrible circumstances?

attributes.action: Ban the taking of photographs of children in school without the child's consent
attributes.background: The concept of private life is a broad one which encompasses the right to identity.  A pupil's image reveals his or her unique characteristics and constitutes one of the chief attributes of his or her personality.
attributes.additional_details: A child, over the age of 12, must be able to give or withdraw consent to the taking of his or her images in addition to the wishes and feelings of the parents/legal guardians.  At present, there are guidelines published by the Information Commissioners Office as to the taking of photographs at schools.  We argue that this is not sufficient because the use of personal mobile phones within a class room setting by a tutor is not prohibited.

attributes.action: House of Lords/Commons respect the will of people and not stop Article 50
attributes.background: In June the UK voters voted to leave the EU; we were told the result would stand but each day pro EU politicians and supporters try to block our democratic voice. I propose we sign this petition to show the will of the people must be carried out no matter what. Teresa May can invoke Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Todays proposal from the House of Lords just proves the establishment think their views are more important than the 17,410,742 million who voted to leave the EU in a valid referendum.

attributes.action: Urgently bring forward the planned works to the A417 missing link / Birdlip Hill
attributes.background: The A417 birdlip hill (Gloucester) is a notorious accident black spot and is gridlocked on a daily basis, which has a huge impact on commuters, businesses and visitors to the area. The planned works to improve the road much be brought forward as soon as possible to rectify this horrendous situation
attributes.additional_details: http://a417missinglink.co.uk

attributes.action: Government to Stop using private enterprise caterer and return military cooks
attributes.background: At present the services use private enterprise caterer such as Sodexo Catering Services. and the standard of food provided is not to a suitable standards.  and as the cost is increasing this situation should be rectified
attributes.additional_details: As members of the services are on a compulsory pay to dine scheme and it would appear their complaints are ignored. the government must take action.  The services have to have catering staff for service in areas of hostility these should also be in charge af army cook houses

attributes.action: Give all animal abusers a proper and minimum length sentence, not just a fine.
attributes.background: I have seen may stories of animal abusers and neglecters getting away with just a fine. I believe and demand they should be given a full proper minimum sentence term as a punishment for what they have done. Animals have feelings, not just physical but emotional and mental scars. Please sign, share.
attributes.additional_details: There have been many videos on Facebook going around of animal being abused and the criminals have only being given a fine which is just not enough. They should be punished like any other criminal for the harm that they have done. Animals can suffer the emotional and mental torture for the criminals have done. This is not fair for somebody who is voiceless and cant escape, only cry, squeal, be scared, shaking and trapped. This is wrong. Please sign, share and tweet.

attributes.action: Stop GCSE Maths needed for a Level 3 where someone has the SpLD dyscalculia.
attributes.background: How are people with an SpLD supposed to advance in their chosen career if they constantly face hurdles.  They do not get enough support in education as it is without having to face battle after battle.
attributes.additional_details: My 21 year old has a diagnosis of dyscalculia.  At school she got a GCSE Grade E in maths and has no understanding of the subject.  She has a L2 qualification in childcare and wants to progress in her chosen career by taking a L3.  She can begin the course but will not pass until she gets a C in maths. This is discrimination.

attributes.action: Stop the British Army disbanding the world's most famous Motorcycle Display Team
attributes.background: The team, the oldest and most famous motorcycle display team in the world, the White Helmets has made a considerable contribution over the years to the Army’s Community Engagement activities performing spectacular feats. The Army had decided to cut back and disband this Proud national treasure.
attributes.additional_details: Help show your support for this impressive British treasure that is internationally renowned and is a jewel in British military history by signing this petition. We should be proud and show our support for the forces and it's ability to engage with the people of the world and the white helmets are apart of the way we showcase our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Stop Govia Thameslink( GTR) from being allowed to increase fares in 2017
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink the owners of Southern Rail have consistently failed to provide a service which could be considered acceptable in any reasonable way. 
With both individuals and businesses losing millions they should not be allowed to raise fares when they are not providing a proper service.
attributes.additional_details:
With well documented proof that they have consistently failed to provide a proper service, have left passengers stranded and have cost individuals & businesses millions in lost revenue collectively the owners of Southern Rail should have no automatic right to increase fares when they have failed miserably to provide an acceptable service for the last 8 months of 2016. 

This issue has been raised in the house several times and is public knowledge.

attributes.action: Initiate a Parliamentary Inquiry into the UK Insurance Industry
attributes.background:
The UK Insurance Industry operates under practices which are in direct contrast to the interests of its customers.
Involving multiple entities in any single claim increases costs which are passed on to the policy holder's insurer.  
Cases are settled to avoid costs in spite of no fault situations
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/money/blog/2012/sep/14/insurance-companies-defraud-us

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/money/insurance/article4632734.ece

http://www.mindfulmoney.co.uk/mindful-news/an-end-to-auto-renewals-insurers-forced-to-provide-premium-comparison/

http://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/10/the-car-insurance-industry-is-a-disgusting-racket/

http://www.emeraldinsight.com/doi/abs/10.1016/S1529-2096%2806%2907002-7

http://uk.practicallaw.com/2-200-4590?q=&qp=&qo=&qe=

attributes.action: Make Politics a mandatory subject for the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: Elections in the US and the recent Brexit vote demonstrate key decisions that the people need to have a good background in Politics to vote on. Giving an education promotes this exploration of politics earlier than just 6 months before a referendum/election. Students can make up their own mind.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-1.png

http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-2.png

People need the chance to have an educated vote, not voting on personality or party without understanding.

attributes.action: Make humira free to patients with the eye condition uvietus
attributes.background: Uvietus can make people lose their eyesight , humira is known to settle the uvietus down and stop it flaring up giving the patient a chance of getting their eyes operated on , ie cataract operation. This drug is free in Scotland and Wales but not from NHS England . Why

attributes.action: Ask the Treasury to abolish the proposed company car tax changes.
attributes.background: The Government have pushed the public to buy "clean cars" via grants and tax breaks. Thousands of drivers including myself have followed their advice and incentives to purchase. They are now looking tax us for following their advice - The changes are unjust and a u-turn leaving us out of pocket.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us have made the decision to buy a more expensive hybrid car because UKGOV asked us to by offering financial contributions and tax breaks. My family and I, (like many others) are now facing greater tax bills than I had with my previous diesel vehicle - How is this fair? I feel the public have been miss-sold and miss-guided by UKGOV. 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3909606/Company-car-drivers-face-paying-thousands-tax-new-plans-announced-month.html

attributes.action: To grant leave to remain in the UK for my wife whom I'm married for 26 years.
attributes.background: I married to my wife a Singapore citizen for 26 years and have two children born in the UK and I am a UK citizen, we submitted many application over 18 years for Visa for my wife to remain in the UK but all was rejected(6 in all)After many tries and different forms the application is rejected again.
attributes.additional_details: I have medical problems and had two operations in 3 months and need someone to look after me and also suffering from depression.I have wasted most of my savings paying for the applications and recent application had to be submitted with medical insurance and the price has gone up for new applications.My family life has been ruined because of this and my kids grew up not knowing their mother well.We have a grandchild who was born April of this year.We have a right to be together.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Stop BT having the monopoly on installing phone lines so other providers can.
attributes.background: As consumers in this day and age we should be able to have options to use a company for a service or not. BT have not been able to provide myself and others on the estate with a phone line or internet services, myself since June 2016 others longer than 8 months
attributes.additional_details: some of the residents including myself on the estate have gone down the complaints route to the CEO and it's still not been resolved and no foreseeable dates for a resolution either. Only BT install phone lines then rent them to other providers. There is literally nothing any of us have been able to do. Every week we chase for an update to be told it's still being looked at. No dates no resolution and no phone line and Internet

attributes.action: Make our Waters Safe- Licensing and Alcohol Regulation of Watercraft
attributes.background: The Railways & Transportation Safety Act of 2003 in Section 80 already starts to cover the control of being under the influence, all it needs is to be signed by the Minister of Shipping (Robert Goodwill MP) for it to be enforced. This can then also be expanded into licensing watercraft.
attributes.additional_details:
British Waters are one of only a few that don’t require a license to operate leisure craft on the water, nor is there any regulation on being under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Most European countries, Australia and the USA all require a license to operate a vessel on the water. The US Coastguard name alcohol in their top five contributing factors of accidents. 
Lives at sea matter. We have legislation for our roads, why not our waters. 
For more info: www.facebook.com/makeourwaterssafe

attributes.action: Urgently review age-based referrals for breast cancer screening women under 30.
attributes.background:
Under 30's automatically considered as non-urgent referral of up to 3 months.

Over 30's can expect to be seen within days/weeks.

Both can have same symptoms. 

This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/news/health/mum-with-breast-cancer-urges-women-to-trust-their-instincts-1-4089771

https://www.gofundme.com/breastiesin20s

attributes.action: Don't allow travel firms to increase fares during school holidays
attributes.background: As hard working people we like to enjoy time away with our families. Yet from both ends we are penalised, fines for taking children out of school or double/triple fares during the holidays. If these companies stopped taking advantage I'm sure you would see a vast change in the absences at school.

attributes.action: Make children and young people in care's funding go up to the age of 21!
attributes.background: People who have been through the care system will understand....The need for support at 18 years old but none being accessible because there is no funding. We need to fight to change this!

attributes.action: The UK Government must commit to publicly destroying all stockpiled ivory.
attributes.background: Between 2009 and 2014, 40% of all illegal wildlife seizures made by the UK’s Border Force were ivory items. In 2015, 110kg of ivory were captured at Heathrow airport in one of the UK’s largest seizures of illegal ivory. We call on the UK Government to commit to destroying any stockpiles of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly destroying ivory stockpiles will raise awareness that the $20bn annual illegal wildlife trade is the 4th largest global illegal activity. This action will send a clear message to the world that the UK will not tolerate illegal trafficking and commercial trade in any raw or worked ivory and that we support a near total ban on domestic ivory trade. Most importantly, it will emphasise to current and future generations that ivory is worthless unless it is on wild living elephants.
